00049 #define DEFAULT_PROMPT          "libfreedom# "
00050 
00054 #define PROMPT_FORMAT           "libfreedom[%s]# "
00055 
00059 #define PROMPT_MAX_CHARS        30
00060 
00064 #define EXIT_COMMAND_NAME       "exit"
00065 
00069 #define READLINE_NAME           "libfreedom"
00070 
00075 #define ROOT_DIRECTORY          (-1)
00076 
00080 static command_list_t console_commands;
00081 
00085 static int current_layer_id = ROOT_DIRECTORY;
00086 
00090 static char console_prompt[PROMPT_MAX_CHARS+1] = DEFAULT_PROMPT;
00091 
00095 static command_t root_directory_commands[] = {
00096         {LAYER_LINK, 
00097                         "link", 
00098                         "Changes to link layer directory"}, 
00099         {LAYER_NET, 
00100                         "net", 
00101                         "Changes to net layer directory"},
00102         {LAYER_UNRELIABLE, 
00103                         "unreliable", 
00104                         "Changes to unreliable transport layer directory"},
00105         {LAYER_RELIABLE, 
00106                         "reliable", 
00107                         "Changes to reliable transport layer directory"}
00108 };
00109 
00114 #define ROOT_DIRECTORY_SIZE (sizeof(root_directory_commands)/sizeof(command_t))
00115

00202 /*============================================================================*/

00205 
00206 void console_initialize() {
00207         /* Allow conditional parsing of the ~/.inputrc file. */
00208         rl_readline_name = READLINE_NAME;
00209 
00210         /* Tell the completer that we want a crack first. */
00211         rl_attempted_completion_function = console_completion;
00212 
00213         /* Override sigpipe handler. */
00214         signal(SIGPIPE, handler_SIGPIPE);
00215 
00216         /* Load directory commands. */
00217         load_commands(ROOT_DIRECTORY);
00218 }
00219 /******************************************************************************/
00220 void console_loop() {
00221         char *line, *s;
00222         int result;
00223         
00224         while (1) {
00225 
00226         line = readline(console_prompt);
00227         if (!line) {
00228                 printf("\n");
00229                 /* EOF received. */
00230                 break;
00231         }
00232 
00233         /* 
00234          * Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the line.
00235          * Then, if there is anything left, add it to the history 
00236          * list and execute it. 
00237          */
00238         s = strip_whitespaces(line);
00239         if (*s) {
00240                 add_history(s);
00241                 result = execute_line(s);
00242                 if (result == CONSOLE_EXIT) {
00243                         return;
00244                 }
00245         }
00246 
00247                 /* Dispose line read. */
00248         free(line);
00249     }
00250 }
00251 
00252 /*============================================================================*/
00253 /* Private functions implementations.                                         */
00254 /*============================================================================*/
00255 
00256 char *strip_whitespaces(char *string) {
00257         register char *s, *t;
00258 
00259         for (s = string; whitespace (*s); s++);
00260     
00261         if (*s == 0) {
00262         return s;
00263         }
00264 
00265         t = s + strlen (s) - 1;
00266         while (t > s && whitespace (*t)) {
00267         t--;
00268         }
00269         *++t = '\0';
00270 
00271         return s;
00272 }
00273 /******************************************************************************/
00274 int execute_line (char *line) {
00275         register int i;
00276         command_t *command;
00277         char *command_name;
00278         char *command_args;
00279         int result;
00280 
00281         /* command_name receives the first word of the line. */
00282         i = 0;
00283         while (line[i] && whitespace(line[i])) {
00284         i++;
00285         }
00286         command_name = line + i;
00287         while (line[i] && !whitespace(line[i])) {
00288         i++;
00289         }
00290         if (line[i]) {
00291         line[i++] = '\0';
00292         }
00293         
00294         /* If command is the exit command, we go back one directory or 
00295          * finish execution in case we are at the root directory. */
00296         if (strcmp(command_name, EXIT_COMMAND_NAME) == 0) {
00297                 if (current_layer_id != ROOT_DIRECTORY) {
00298                         /* Request new list of commands */
00299                         load_commands(ROOT_DIRECTORY);
00300                         return CONSOLE_OK;
00301                 } else {
00302                         return CONSOLE_EXIT;
00303                 }
00304         }
00305         
00306         /* Translate the command name to a command_t struct.
00307          * If the command doesn't exists, CONSOLE_ERROR is returned. */
00308         command = find_command(command_name);
00309         if (!command) {
00310         fprintf (stderr, "%s: No such command.\n\n", command_name);
00311         return CONSOLE_ERROR;
00312     }
00313 
00314         /* command_args receives arguments, if any. */
00315         while (whitespace(line[i])) {
00316         i++;
00317         }
00318         command_args = line + i;
00319         
00320         if (current_layer_id == ROOT_DIRECTORY) {
00321                 /* Request new list of commands */
00322                 load_commands(command->id);
00323         } else {
00324                 /* Request the execution of the command to the deamon. */
00325                 result = libconsole_send_command(current_layer_id, 
00326                                 command->id, command_args);
00327                 if (result == LIBCONSOLE_COMMAND_ERROR) {
00328                         /* Print the command help if the command fails. */
00329                         printf("%s\n\n", command->doc);
00330                 } else if (result == LIBCONSOLE_ERROR) {
00331                         printf("Error sending command.\n");
00332                 }
00333         }
00334         
00335         return CONSOLE_OK;
00336 }
00337 /******************************************************************************/
00338 void load_commands(int layer_id) {
00339         current_layer_id = layer_id;
00340         
00341         /* Dispose command list if it is not the directory command */
00342         if (console_commands.list != root_directory_commands) {
00343                 free(console_commands.list);
00344         }
00345 
00346         /* If requested layer_id is the layer directory, 
00347          * return the directory command list. */
00348         if (current_layer_id == ROOT_DIRECTORY) {
00349                 console_commands.list = root_directory_commands;
00350         console_commands.size = ROOT_DIRECTORY_SIZE;
00351         update_prompt();
00352         return;
00353         }
00354 
00355         /* Try to load command. If error occurs we fall back 
00356          * to LAYER_DIRECTORY, and return the directory command list. */
00357         if (libconsole_load_commands(&console_commands, current_layer_id) 
00358                         == LIBCONSOLE_ERROR) {
00359                 current_layer_id = ROOT_DIRECTORY;
00360                 console_commands.list = root_directory_commands;
00361         console_commands.size = ROOT_DIRECTORY_SIZE;
00362         update_prompt();
00363         fprintf(stderr, "error: Could not load commands.\n");
00364                 return;
00365         }
00366         
00367         update_prompt();
00368         return;
00369 }
00370 /******************************************************************************/
00371 void update_prompt() {
00372         if (current_layer_id == ROOT_DIRECTORY) {
00373                 strncpy(console_prompt, DEFAULT_PROMPT, PROMPT_MAX_CHARS);
00374         } else {
00375                 /* Seek current directory name. */
00376                 int i;
00377                 for (i = 0; i < ROOT_DIRECTORY_SIZE; i++) {
00378                 if (root_directory_commands[i].id == current_layer_id) {
00379                         /* Directory found. Updating console prompt. */
00380                                 snprintf(console_prompt, PROMPT_MAX_CHARS, PROMPT_FORMAT, 
00381                                                 root_directory_commands[i].name);
00382                                 return;
00383                 }
00384                 }
00385                 
00386                 /* Current directory missing. */
00387                 snprintf(console_prompt, PROMPT_MAX_CHARS, PROMPT_FORMAT,"?");
00388         }
00389 }
00390 /******************************************************************************/
00391 char *duplicate_string(char *s) {
00392         char *r;
00393         int string_length;
00394         string_length = strlen(s);
00395         r = malloc(string_length + 1);
00396         strncpy(r, s, string_length + 1);
00397         return r;
00398 }
00399 /******************************************************************************/
00400 command_t *find_command(char *command_name) {
00401         register int i;
00402 
00403         for (i = 0; i<console_commands.size; i++) {
00404         if (strcmp (command_name, console_commands.list[i].name) == 0) {
00405                 return (&console_commands.list[i]);
00406         }
00407         }
00408 
00409         return ((command_t *)NULL);
00410 }
00411 /******************************************************************************/
00412 char **console_completion (const char *text, int start, int end) {
00413         char **matches;
00414 
00415         matches = (char **)NULL;
00416 
00417         /* If this word is at the start of the line, then it is a command
00418          * to complete.  Otherwise it is the name of a file in the current
00419          * directory. */
00420         if (start == 0) {
00421                 matches = rl_completion_matches (text, command_generator);
00422         }
00423 
00424         return (matches);
00425 }
00426 /******************************************************************************/
00427 char *command_generator (const char *text, int state) {
00428         static int list_index;
00429         static int len;
00430         char *name;
00431 
00432         /* If this is a new word to complete, initialize it now.  This
00433      * includes saving the length of TEXT for efficiency, and
00434      * initializing the index variable to 0. */
00435         if (!state) {
00436         list_index = 0;
00437         len = strlen (text);
00438     }
00439 
00440         /* Return the next name which partially matches from the command list. */
00441         while (list_index < console_commands.size){
00442                 name = console_commands.list[list_index].name;
00443         list_index++;
00444 
00445         if (strncmp (name, text, len) == 0) {
00446                 return (duplicate_string(name));
00447         }
00448     }
00449 
00450         /* If this is the exit command, return it. */
00451         if (list_index == console_commands.size) {
00452                 /* This will allow only one exit command. */
00453                 list_index++;
00454                 if (strncmp (text, EXIT_COMMAND_NAME, len) == 0) {
00455                 return (duplicate_string(EXIT_COMMAND_NAME));
00456                 }
00457         }
00458 
00459         /* If no names match, then return NULL. */
00460         return ((char *)NULL);
00461 }       
00462 /******************************************************************************/
00463 void handler_SIGPIPE(int signal) {
00464         printf("SIGPIPE received.\n");
00465         /* Ignoring. This is necessary to handle the clients' disconnections. */
00466 }
00467 /******************************************************************************/
